text: a stand at northeastern Chinese eatery
from the outside until you see this guy
it's his friends on the inside that are
cooking stir frying up a storm in Harbin
City the robots prepare traditional fear
we manually put four materials into the
cabinet and then we just press one
button then the robot can handle it all
then it's another machines turn to serve
the dishes every button here represents
a table and press a button and then the
robot will take dishes or dumplings to
the table tables with waiting adoring
customers some clearly impressed the
dishes taste just as those made by human
chefs if no one tells me I think people
won't see the difference the restaurant
manager says the robots not only draw in
the customers they're also saving money
shifts cost a us one dollar sixty a day
to run the waiters are near 30 cents
there's also a production line making
robots for other Chinese eateries the
unusual dining experience could become
commonplace for the next generation Erin
soma BBC news
